alert.note: Alert for Lewis; Mason (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued January 03 at 10:12AM EST until January 03 at 12:30PM EST by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1230 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON FOR NORTHWESTERN LEWIS, EASTERN MASON, SOUTHERN ADAMS AND SOUTHEASTERN BROWN COUNTIES... At 1012 AM EST, local law enforcement in Adams County reported flash flooding, with vehicles stuck in high water near route 41 and 136. Between 2 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 0.25 to 0.5 inches in 1 hour. While the heaviest rainfall is ending, flash flooding is expected to linger through the morning hours. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Law enforcement reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that may experience flash flooding include... Maysville, Washington, West Union, Manchester, Ripley, Aberdeen, Vanceburg, Lewisburg, Tollesboro, Rome, Concord, Trinity, Rectorville, Ribolt, Herron Hill, Bradysville, Epworth, Orangeburg and Bentonville. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...0.25-0.5 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life. To report flash flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
